More Notes: The paper primarily discusses land-use adaptation in response to climate change and its impact on farm net income, employment, and land allocation in Chile. No specific quantitative economic metrics like ROI or NPV are provided on page 1. The 'Value' column is marked '0' due to the absence of explicit quantified values on this page.
Land devoted to annual crops declines by 7 percent relative to the baseline under the 2040 climate scenarios. This is relative to a baseline of 508,000 hectares, so it is a reduction of 38,000 ha.
Land devoted to annual crops declines by 7 percent relative to the baseline under the 2040 climate scenarios. This is relative to a baseline of 508,000 hectares, so it is a reduction of 38,000 ha.
Fruit plantations also decline by 7 percent in the 2040 scenarios.  It is not clear what the baseline is.
Fruit plantations also decline by 7 percent in the 2040 scenarios.  It is not clear what the baseline is.
Land of annual crops increases slightly by over 4 percent in the moderate scenario. This is relative to a baseline of 508,000 hectares, so it is an increase of 21,000 ha.

In the 2070 climate scenarios, the land of annual crops declines relative to the baseline by less than one percent in the severe scenario.  This is relative to a baseline of 508,000 hectares, so it is a reduction of 5,000 ha.
Fruit plantations increase by 6 percent in 2070 under the severe scenario. It is not clear what the baseline is.
Fruit plantations increase by 14 percent under the moderate scenario. It is not clear what the baseline is.
Table grapes show significant losses of land under all the scenarios.
Avocado plantations are projected to expand geographically under all the scenarios.
Pastures and forage lands as a whole decline across all the scenarios.
Forestry land is expected to increase by approximately 2 to 3 percent under all the climate-change scenarios.
Forestry land in 2040 is projected to increase by nearly 83,000 hectares (3 percent) over the baseline.
Net revenues in agriculture and forestry sectors decrease by 5% from baseline in 2040 under A240 scenario.
Net revenues in agriculture and forestry sectors decrease by 14% from baseline in 2070 under A270 scenario.
Slight increase in net income over baseline in moderate climate-change scenarios (B240 and B270). A very small number was provided as a placeholder.
Net revenues from all fruit are expected to decline by 76% under severe change scenario A270 in the longer term.
Net revenues from all fruit are expected to decline by 31% under moderate change scenarios in the longer term.
